resources:
PObY-A Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer Dashboard Threats Scan Privacy Settings Applications Data Safety Preferences
Scan for known threats within installed applications
Review the installed applications and their permissions Enhance privacy settings based on best practices PObY-A preferences PObY-A privacy policy
This permission is required to set the screen lock policy (timeout, display notifications)
Start Cancel
Screen lock is enabled Enabling screen lock requires a form of user authentication before interacting with the device. This strengthens application and data protection and overall improves the device security. You will be redirected to the screen lock settings
Screen timeout is set to 1 minute or less You should set inactivity timeout to avoid unsanctioned usage of the device if you leave it unattended. The inactivity timeout not only blackens your screen after stipulated time period but also kicks in other security features such as screen lock that protect your device when you leave it unattended. This action will set screen timeout to 1 minute
Passwords are visible while typing Keeping device unlock pattern visible during device unlock can reveal the pattern and is vulnerable to shoulder surfing attack. This action will make passwords pattern invisible
Development settings are enabled Enabling Developer Options allows a user to drastically alter certain very advanced settings on the device. This can severely affect the way device functions and exposes greater and developmental features to the user. You will be redirected to \"Development settings\":\n - Disable \"Developer Options\"
SIM card lock is enabled A SIM card PIN locks the SIM and prevents anyone from removing the SIM card from your device and use it on any other device without knowing the PIN. Also, you might choose to store your contacts and messages on the SIM card and thus it is highly recommended that you safeguard this valuable personal data by setting a custom PIN on the SIM card(s). You will be redirected to security settings menu:\n - Choose "SIM card lock" \n - Enable "Lock SIM Card".
Network provided time is enabled Use network-provided time setting fetches the date and time information from the cellular provider and is generally more accurate and reliable than your own managed and set date and time. Accurate date and time could help in forensics, device recovery through Android Device Manager and maintain application and logs in a time-sync manner.
Add users from lock screen Users and the guest profile can do most of the same things as the device\'s owner, but each profile has its own storage space. Guests could install malicious apps or carry out any other malicious activities that may compromise overall device security. Also, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connections are shared which could give guests unauthorized access to networks/devices that could compromise data. You will be redirected to \"Multiple users\" settings: - Disable \"Add users from lock screen\" .
Show notifications on lock screen If the device is lost or is unattended, then disabling notifications do not display any notification information on the locked screen. This information might be private or confidential and thus unwarranted disclosures could be avoided. You will be redirected to \"Notifications\" settings:\n - Set \"Notifications on lock screen\" to "Don't show notifications at all".
Location is enabled Location allows applications such as Maps and Internet websites to gather and use data indicating the user\'s location. The user\'s location is determined using available information from cellular network data, local Wi-Fi networks, Bluetooth and GPS. If the user turns off Location Services, the user will be prompted to turn it back on again the next time any application tries to use this feature. You will be redirected to \"Location\" settings:\n - Disable \"Use location\"
Voice assistance enabled Voice assistance allows some applications to listen constantly to everything you say in order to detect the keyword that will start a command. You will be redirected to \"Assistance settings\"\n- Set \"Assist App\" to None
Autofill service enabled Autofill service can present a security risk as it\'s used to automatically fill the contents of the screen on behalf of a given user. You will be redirected to \"Languages & inputs\" \n - Show advanced options \n - Set \"Autofill service\" to \"None\"
Bluetooth is enabled Leaving Bluetooth on can open your device to potential security risks. You will be redirected to Bluetooth settings
Wi-Fi is enabled Leaving Wi-Fi on can open your device to potential security risks. You will be redirected to \"Wi-Fi\" settings.
Application debugging disabled Application debugging allows to select an installed App to debug. You will be redirected to \"Development settings\" \n - Set \"Select debug app\" to \"Nothing\".
Android Debug Bridge enabled Application Debug Bridge allows the device to respond to features such as USB debugging and other such features that could be exploited to get malicious access to the device sub-system. You will be redirected to \"Development settings\"\n- Disable \"USB debugging\".
Wi-Fi scan always enabled This feature use geotagged location data of Wi-Fi routers around you to estimate your location, even if Wi-Fi and GPS are turned off. You will be redirected to \"Scanning settings\"\n- Disable \"Wi-Fi scanning\".
Bluetooth scan always enabled This feature use geotagged location data of Bluetooth accessories around you to estimate your location, even if Bluetooth and GPS are turned off. You will be redirected to \"Scanning settings\"\n- Disable \"Bluetooth scanning\".
This permission has no description
Rescan Scanning Please check your internet connection Database not updated No threat found Retry Please check the internet connection Empty threats database Possible threat found
Status Warning NormalÂ¨ Medium Progress Scanning Hide system Apps Show system Apps OK Package name Install date Update date Settingsw No permission granted Third Parties System Uninstalled Uninstall Uninstall date Threat Trust Untrust Trusted Suspicious
Monitoring Service Applications live monitoring New application installed Application removed You will be redirected to \"Date and time\" settings: \n - Enable \"Use network-provided time\"\n - Enable \"Use network-provided time zone\". Threats found
Live monitoring Enable realtime monitoring Database URL Domain from where the threats database will be downloaded. Deep Scan (Advanced scan) Enable deep scan for advanced threats detection. This type of scan may require resources and time depending on number of application installed. Include system\'s applications during threat scan may take time and result some false positives THREAT Updating Failed Success
